meanings.definition: To assign a number to something before it is officially numbered.
meanings.sent1: Before the event, they were prenumbering the seats for the guests.
meanings.sent2: The librarian was prenumbering the books before they were shelved.
meanings.sent3: The students prenumbered their test papers as a prank, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: The chef prenumbered the ingredients for the recipe, ensuring a smooth cooking process.
meanings.sent5: Prenumbering the boxes made it easier to keep track of inventory.

meanings.definition: The act of numbering something before it is officially numbered.
meanings.sent1: The prenumbering of the documents saved time during the filing process.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the prenumbering on the tickets at the event.
meanings.sent3: The prenumbering of the cupcakes made them look like a math-themed treat.
meanings.sent4: The prenumbering of the pages in the book hinted at a hidden code.
meanings.sent5: The prenumbering of the products helped in organizing the warehouse efficiently.
